city.name: Tunis
city.description: Capital and largest city of Tunisia, founded by the Berbers in the 2nd millennium BC

landmarks.name: Medina of Tunis
landmarks.description: UNESCO World Heritage site, one of the best preserved Islamic cities in the Arab world
highlights: 700 monuments including palaces, mosques, and fountains
Zitouna Mosque - spiritual heart of the medina

landmarks.name: Carthage
landmarks.description: Ancient Phoenician city-state and later Roman city, legendary rival of Rome
highlights: Antonine Baths - among the largest Roman baths

landmarks.name: Bardo National Museum
landmarks.description: One of the most important museums in the Mediterranean region, housed in a 19th-century palace
highlights: World's largest collection of Roman mosaics

landmarks.name: Sidi Bou Said
landmarks.description: Picturesque cliff-side village famous for its blue and white architecture
highlights: Iconic blue doors and white walls
Artists and galleries tucked into alleys

city.name: Istanbul
city.description: Historic city spanning Europe and Asia, once the capital of the Byzantine and Ottoman empires

landmarks.name: Hagia Sophia
landmarks.description: Iconic former cathedral and mosque known for its massive dome and layered history.

landmarks.name: Sultan Ahmed Mosque
landmarks.description: 17th-century imperial mosque famed for its blue Iznik tiles and six minarets.
highlights: Blue tile interior with floral motifs
Landmark of the old city skyline

landmarks.name: Topkapi Palace
landmarks.description: Ottoman palace complex that served as the imperial residence for centuries.

landmarks.name: Galata Tower
landmarks.description: Medieval stone tower with panoramic views over the Golden Horn.
highlights: Stone tower built by Genoese settlers
